keyTakeAways: A man named Billy Joe Cagle, a convicted felon from Cartersville, Georgia, planned to shoot up Atlanta’s Hartsfield-Jackson International Airport via a social media livestream.
Cagle was apprehended at the airport after family members alerted authorities to his social media threats and possession of an AR-15 assault rifle with 27 rounds of ammunition.
The arrest highlights the role of community vigilance and family awareness in preventing violent acts.

Cagle has been charged with making terroristic threats, criminal attempt to commit aggravated assault, possession of a firearm during the commission of a felony, and possession of a firearm by a felon.
Police and federal authorities are investigating how Cagle legally obtained the gun, which authorities state he was not allowed to possess.
The incident was prevented due to early warning from family members, demonstrating the importance of social media monitoring and mental health awareness.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Billy Joe Cagle, a 49-year-old convicted felon from Cartersville, Georgia, was arrested at Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport after his family alerted law enforcement that he had streamed on social media a plan to 'shoot it up' the airport. Authorities found an AR-15 assault rifle and 27 rounds of ammunition in his Chevrolet pickup truck parked outside the terminal. Cagle, who had previously disclosed on Facebook that he suffers from schizophrenia, was taken into custody following a body camera-recorded arrest and is now charged with making terroristic threats, criminal attempt to commit aggravated assault, and possession of a firearm by a felon. The incident was averted due to early detection by family members and community awareness, prompting praise from local officials and federal leaders. The case underscores the dangers of social media threats, mental health struggles, and the importance of public vigilance in preventing mass shootings.
title: Man Arrested at Atlanta Airport After Planning Mass Shooting on Social Media
